entries.meaning: The state of having no job; joblessness.
The phenomenon of joblessness in an economy.
examples: Unemployment has been considered a cause of crime.

entries.meaning: The level of joblessness in an economy, often measured as a percentage of the workforce.
examples: Unemployment was reported at 5.2% in May, up from 4.9% in April.

entries.meaning: (countable) A type of joblessness due to a particular economic mechanism.
examples: All unemployments, seasonal, frictional, cyclical, classical, whatever, mean that you're out of work.

entries.meaning: (countable) An instance or period of joblessness.
examples: Until then his life had consisted of low-paying jobs, numerous unemployments, and drug use.
